::Fenox::

Fenox sighs, seeing that D was upset. "Sorry," she says to him before 
listening to his next words, still not understanding. He wasn't 
human, he was a bot. At least she thought he was a bot. He looked 
more like a bot than a human.

She jumps back as he bolts upright, relaxing when she sees that he 
wasn't bolting a her. Fenox looks down and reads the words he wrote.

"Oh!" She exclaims as she finally understands what D had been trying 
to say. "Well, whoever you came with were all killed in that crash. 
I'm very surprised you survived. That ship was a death trap for 
anyone in it."






--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> 
> 
> * D leaned back and sighed with frustration. She hadn't gotten it 
at all! To 
> Hell with his limited speech!
> D pawed at the ground.*
> 
> " No."
> 
> * He had to find just the right words or they could be at this all 
day, and 
> it might take him a while before he could say just what he meant. 
But he 
> made it a goal to learn how to speak more in the future.
> D looked at Fenox for a second, not angry at her for not 
understanding but 
> was frustrated.
> He searched his mind like mad.*
> 
> " Where hu-man flesh...um...like me?"
> 
> * That wasn't exactly right either. D sat back. What to do?!
> Wait! He bolted upright, his ears straight in the air. Maybe he 
didn't have 
> to speak to them at all! His speech might be in need of work but 
his writing 
> was something that was perfect.
> D snapped his head down to look at the ground as he scribbled just 
what he 
> wanted to say in the dirt of the island.
> She HAD to understand!
> After he was through D pointed to the words, looking from Fenox to 
them and 
> back again.
> On the ground he had wrote: Where are the humans I had come here 
with?*
> 
> 
> 
>
